content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Jun 12 (APP): Indus River System Authority (IRSA) on Thursday released 255,822 cusecs water from various rim stations with inflow of 270,639 cusecs. According to the data released by IRSA, the water level in River Indus at Tarbela Dam was 1444.32 feet which was 42.32 feet higher than the dead level of 1402.00 feet. Water inflow and outflow in the dam was recorded as 152,400 cusecs and 150,500 cusecs, respectively. The water level in River Jhelum at Mangla Dam was 1164.65 feet, which was 114.65 feet higher than its dead level of 1,050 feet. The inflow and outflow of water was recorded 37,917 cusecs and 25,000 cusecs, respectively. The release of water at Kalabagh, Taunsa , Guddu and Sukkur was recorded as 179,174, 133,709, 97,238 and 41,375 cusecs, respectively. Similarly, from River Kabul, a total of 26,500 cusecs of water released at Nowshera and 23,333 cusecs released from River Chenab at Marala.
